column4: Shouldn't it already be configured? LILO is the last thing to install from the CD.

reverse engineer the 'registration code' or whatever?

no
that's nothing to with linux, just x86 asm

somewhere, when you enter yr code, there's a check, is the code good or not - if you're lucky it'll be done the stupidest way, and the real code will be strcmp'd with what you entered, and you can read the real code out of memory, but I doubt it
